data.text: @LongDesertTrain @andyaschmidt @amillerphd Lots of infections mean a few reinfections. It will likely be like India and Indonesia and get down to near 0. Infection-based immunity lasts a long time and is much better (not 100% but close enough in a background of high immunity) than is being given credit for

@LongDesertTrain @andyaschmidt @amillerphd @mtosterholm Nope. Immunity trumps all. Sorry. We are at that point. No tracing, very little testing, minimal isolation. People coming to work sniffly, sore throat, look like death warmed over in a few cases.

@andyaschmidt @LongDesertTrain @Nutmeg031992 @amillerphd @mtosterholm Yep...All coastal areas peaked by Jan 8, west coast and east coast. Basically done by end of January and masks would have been totally safe to take off by that time in all situations.

@LongDesertTrain @Nutmeg031992 @amillerphd @mtosterholm I think Omicron infections might have peaked in all blue places by January 8 showing up in the data over the next week. In theory they might have chopped off the top of the curve, but I doubt it. The data is so similar in different districts with different policies.
@andyaschmidt @LongDesertTrain @amillerphd @mtosterholm Ok as @LongDesertTrain schools are probably an exception
@LongDesertTrain @andyaschmidt @amillerphd @mtosterholm True, although as a childless adult I don't really follow that closely
@Nutmeg031992 @andyaschmidt @amillerphd @mtosterholm I bet contract tracing, quarantine, & isolation was still happening in schools though, which is pretty important.
@LongDesertTrain @andyaschmidt @amillerphd But reinfections within 1-2 months of any other variant's infections have always happened...I don't think that means much

@andyaschmidt @LongDesertTrain @amillerphd @mtosterholm There is definitely more masking in urban areas (although 90+% is ~useless cloth/surgical), but the efforts to contact trace are non-existent and quarantine-isolation is not mandated either.

@Nutmeg031992 @LongDesertTrain @amillerphd @mtosterholm yeah i think it is very clear that our NPIs did nothing to control the Rt of Omicron anywhere. Careful behavior did control the spread in small pockets of very educated public health minded folks. Not epidemiologically important except it includes all the epidemiologists.
